title: Quordle today - hints and answers for Thursday, August 3 (game #556)
description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

title: The World's first color E-Ink monitor looks wild – but we have questions
description: Dasung's innvoative color E-Ink monitor is a first, but is it ready for prime time?

title: Android’s Nearby Share boost means it’s almost a match for Apple’s AirDrop
description: Nearby Share now allows people to send entire folders to other devices, but it's exclusive to the Google Files app.

title: This new malware is going after Facebook Business accounts
description: A new variant of a known malware spotted targeting Facebook Business accounts.

title: AMD’s RX 7900 XTX is finally in Steam hardware survey but hardly any gamers use it
description: The AMD RX 7900 XTX GPU has finally made it to Steam's hardware survey after nearly a year, but AMD is still in trouble.

title: OnePlus Nord 3 is finally going on sale in the UK, but you'd better hurry!
description: OnePlus brings its Nord 3 to the UK at last, but it's only a limited run for now.

title: This new portable projector from Nebula is built for the outdoors
description: Anker-owned brand Nebula has a new Mars portable projector offering boosted image quality, audio and battery life.

title: Citizen Sleeper 2 Starward Vector release date, story, everything we know
description: Citizen Sleeper 2 Starward Vector has been announced, and there's a lot to learn about the next title in the indie series.

title: Google Assistant gets AI boost - but will it make it smarter?
description: Google is carrying out organizational efforts in its staff, including layoffs, and directing efforts in Assistant’s direction to give it AI-powered capabilities.

title: Amazon expands its live radio app despite Spotify and Clubhouse shutting theirs down
description: Amazon's Amp radio streamer is now available on Android after being exclusively on iOS.

title: Nokia just released two dumb phones like it's 1996 and I'm here for it
description: Take a nostalgia trip back to the year Ask Jeeves was launched – although you won't be able to access it with these phones.

title: Twitter's Blue Ticks are now so toxic that paid users can choose to hide them
description: Twitter Blue paid users are now able to hide their checkmarks to conceal their status.

title: Bargain 61TB SSD is faster than expected in real-life tests, likely to cost under $3,500
description: Solidigm SSD going for the HDD jugular with a surprisingly nippy performance and relatively affordable price tag.

title: Suicide Squad Kill the Justice League release date and latest news
description: Suicide Squad Kill the Justice League's release date has been pushed back. Here's everything we know about the game so far.

title: The DJI Osmo Action 4 is the best GoPro alternative for low-light adventures
description: DJI has launched its new Osmo Action 4 action cam, which boasts a bigger sensor than the GoPro Hero 11 Black.

title: Android phones are getting a welcome ad privacy upgrade
description: Google wants to change the way apps track you on Android with Privacy Sandbox ideas borrowed from Chrome.

title: LG’s most popular OLED TVs just fixed a big brightness problem with a new update
description: LG finally banishes the bothersome bug that made the C2 and G2 OLED TVs dive into darkness.

title: Ransomware attacks have doubled thanks to AI
description: Barracuda finds ransomware attacks are increasing fast across many industries, and AI is to blame.

title: Top US internet hosting company acting as global cybercrime center
description: Some two dozen hacking collectives were using Cloudzy services, including state-sponsored players.

title: AMD confirms ‘enthusiast’ RDNA 3 GPUs are imminent – should Nvidia be worried?
description: It’s officially time to get excited – though it's still far from clear which models AMD is going to launch.

title: The DJI Osmo Action 4 delivers a key improvement to take on the GoPro Hero 11 Black
description: On paper the DJI Osmo Action 4 is only a modest upgrade, but it might just have improved where it matters the most.

title: Philips Hue says it's making smart home cameras that can bamboozle burglars
description: Philips Hue smart lights could soon be joined by some new security cameras that help ward off intruders.

title: Amazon rolls out its virtual health clinic across the entire US
description: Amazon Clinic is now available across the entire US, starting with more than 30 treatable concerns.

title: Nintendo's pulled a Last of Us clone from the eShop after Sony's copyright claim
description: The Last Hope has been removed from the Nintendo eShop after a copyright claim by Sony.

title: Remnant 2 features a secret class that's so hidden you'll have to work for it
description: There's a Remnant 2 class that's been purposely hidden by devs, and you'll have to work really hard to unlock it or find it.

title: The iPhone 15 hits a major milestone on the road to release
description: Apple inches closer to the iPhone 15's launch, crossing major milestone as mass production reportedly kicks off.

title: Google Chrome will now allow one-off microphone or webcam permissions
description: Granting a site temporary access to your mic, camera, or location just got even easier with Chrome 116.

title: Apple is considering AirPods charging cases that can be worn like jewellery
description: Battery warning right before your workout? Soon, you may be able to just loop 'em around your neck and go.

description: A new Meta Quest 3 teaser has again shown off the incoming VR headset – here's everything we expect to see at Meta Connect.

title: Watch out Google users – your account could get deleted if it’s not used
description: Google is planning to clean house when it comes to dormant accounts in a bid to strap up security - make sure you don’t lose your data.

title: Gamers, brace yourselves: AI development could lead to another GPU shortage
description: Forget crypto-bros, AI bros are starting to snatch up GPUs.

title: Telefónica wants to launch the first 5G roaming connection for space
description: The telco plans to offer the 5G in space service commercially in 2024.

title: Diablo 4 players have shattered the barrier between the two seasons with this weird glitch
description: In an effort to transfer characters over from the Eternal Realm to the Seasonal Realm, Diablo 4 players have found a glitch.

description: Spatial audio is finally here for Microsoft Teams, but you might not be able to use it with your swanky new headphones.

title: RAM continues to get cheaper – and there’s a weird reason why
description: Apparently there’s a surge of DDR4 RAM sticks coming to the market which are using repurposed memory modules.

title: The Samsung Galaxy S24 could get one of the Galaxy S23 Ultra’s best features
description: The Samsung Galaxy S24 and S24 Plus could use a battery life-boosting display technology and have smaller bezels.

description: A long-forgotten Barbie web series has been given a second life on Netflix – and it's all down to Barbenheimer.

title: Star Wars Jedi: Survivor is coming to PS4 and Xbox One thanks to 'community demand'

title: Baldur's Gate 3 developers want players to delete their early access saves and uninstall the game ahead of 1.0 release
description: Baldur's Gate 3 developers warn that players will need to delete their early access saves and clients to avoid "unintended conflicts" at launch.

title: Apple sees Vision Pro on Pixar platform
description: Apple, Adobe, Nvidia, and Pixar among those looking to standardize 3D design tools.

title: There’s Y2K kitsch, and then there’s this outrageously priced Bearbrick Bluetooth speaker
description: Rinaro’s Bearbrick Bluetooth speaker collab is Y2K cute but boasts serious quad driver sound – and a weighty price tag.

description: Multiview is officially rolling out to select NFL and WNBA channels, but YouTube confirms more is on the way.
